tl.GUI

Class TGUILayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • tl.GUI.TGUIObject
      • tl.GUI.TGUILayout
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TGUIHBoxLayout, TGUIVBoxLayout

    public abstract class TGUILayout
extends TGUIObject
    TGUIView is an abstract class that provides the basic functionality for TGUIVerticalView and TGUIHorizontalView.
    TGUIViews set properties for each component in the layout, and positions/stretches/organises them to meet the size of its parent.
    If the parent is set to null, then the TGUIView uses the TGUIManager's properties instead.
    Since:
    2.1
    Author:
    Callum Nichols
    See Also:
    TGUIVBoxLayout, TGUIHBoxLayout

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addComponent(TGUIObject... components)
      Adds multiple components to the layout, in the one call, to be organised.
      It will throw a TGUIException if a component is null (note that is actually catches its own throw, but it will still exit the application gracefully).

    • Constructor Detail

      • TGUILayout

        public TGUILayout(TGUIObject parent,
          boolean onAdd)
        TGUIView's constructor. Used to set its parent on construction.
        Parameters:
        parent - - The parent of this TGUIView. Can be set to null.
        onAdd - - Whether or not the layout should re-organise every time a new component is added (true re-organises on add).
        See Also:
        addComponent(TGUIObject)

    • Method Detail

      • setParent

        public void setParent(TGUIObject parent)
        Sets the parent of the layout. This will re-organise each component.
        Parameters:
        parent - - The parent of this TGUIView. Can be set to null.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(TGUIObject component)
        Adds a component to the layout to be organised.
        It will throw a TGUIException if component is null (note that is actually catches its own throw, but it will still exit the application gracefully).
        Parameters:
        component - - The component to add. It must not be null.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(TGUIObject... components)
        Adds multiple components to the layout, in the one call, to be organised.
        It will throw a TGUIException if a component is null (note that is actually catches its own throw, but it will still exit the application gracefully).
        Parameters:
        components - - The components to add. None of them should be null.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(TGUIObject component,
                int index)
        Adds a component to the layout to be organised at an index.
        It will throw a TGUIException if component is null (note that is actually catches its own throw, but it will still exit the application gracefully).
        Parameters:
        component - - The component to add. It must not be null.
        index - - The index to insert the component at.

      • organise

        public void organise()
        Used to manually re-organise the layout.

      • setSpacing

        public void setSpacing(int spacing)
                throws TGUIException
        Sets the spacing in pixels between each component.
        Parameters:
        spacing - - The spacing in pixels. If less than 0, it will throw a TGUIException.
        Throws:
        TGUIException

        - True if the layout is organising upon adding children.

      • toggleStretching

        public void toggleStretching()
        Toggles component stretching off and on (off by default).
        See Also:
        isStretching()

      • isStretching

        public boolean isStretching()
        Used to tell whether or not the layout has stretching turned on.
        Returns:
        - True if the layout is stretching its objects.
        See Also:
        toggleStretching()
